alert.note: Alert for Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 3:42PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Perry, northwestern Knott and southeastern Breathitt Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 341 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rowdy, or 11 miles north of Hazard, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ary around 350 PM EDT. Buck, Talcum and Fisty around 355 PM EDT. Bearville, Decoy and Emmalena around 400 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Carrie, Elmrock, Tina, Hindman, Yellow Mountain, Vest and Vail. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 1 and 11. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 12 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
